arts.ttl: Michael Carrick's cautious goals expectation warning for Middlesbrough star Hayden Hackney
arts.sum: "A big part of our game is controlling the midfield and him and Aidan [Morris] - as well as Dan [Barlaser], Jonny [Howson] or Law [McCabe], whoever plays in there - have to make decision making so important. While Michael Carrick is as delighted as anyone to see Hayden Hackney chipping in with some goals for Middlesbrough, the Boro boss delivered a warning of caution with regard to expectations on the midfielder.

arts.ttl: Michael Carrick picks out the player who 'epitomised' Middlesbrough's victory at West Brom
arts.sum: Michael Carrick described Rav van den Berg as epitomising Middlesbrough's maturity and composure to win at West Brom. Not to the surprise of the Boro boss, the game was a tight one against two good sides expected to be challenging at the top end of the Championship this season.

arts.ttl: Hayden Hackney fires Middlesbrough to back-to-back league wins at West Brom
arts.sum: Hackney scored his second goal in as many games to grab all three points.

arts.ttl: Hayden Hackney scores again to help Middlesbrough to an impressive win at West Brom
arts.sum: Hayden Hackney made it two goals in two games as Middlesbrough carried on their momentum from the weekend to beat league leaders West Brom at the Hawthorns. In a tight game between two promotion contenders, Hackney's second half strike divided the two sides as Boro won a second consecutive Championship game for the first time this season.

arts.ttl: Linesman carried off at West Brom after game paused due to medical incident
arts.sum: Assistant referee Rob Smith was stretchered off after he appeared to feint in the opening minutes of West Bromwich Albion's Championship fixture against Middlesbrough

arts.ttl: Key duo doubts: Middlesbrough team news and predicted XI to face West Brom
arts.sum: The latest team news as Michael Carrick's Middlesbrough gear up to face West Brom in the Championship. The post Key duo doubts: Middlesbrough team news and predicted XI to face West Brom appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Midfield decision to make: West Brom team news and predicted XI to face Middlesbrough
arts.sum: West Brom are back in Championship action this evening with a home clash against Middlesbrough at The Hawthorns.â€¦ The post Midfield decision to make: West Brom team news and predicted XI to face Middlesbrough appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough's task to do what no other side's yet done as Corberan makes West Brom demand
arts.sum: While Paddy McNair is struggling for game-time at West Brom and is unlikely to enjoy a Boro reunion, former loanee Alex Mowatt is a key player for Corberan and netted his third of the season in Saturday's defeat. While Boro face a big task in trying to break down a usually-solid defence on Tuesday evening, at the other end of the pitch they'll have to contend with the Championship's hottest striker right now.

arts.ttl: Carlos Corberan yet to unleash 'electric' option as West Brom position clarified
arts.sum: Although Swift is playing deeper as part of a midfield three, that's not to say that Corberan can't and won't tweak things according to the opponent and 'electric' Diangana remains firmly in his thoughts. Diangana, who is now into his sixth season at The Hawthorns, has operated on both wings for the majority of his time at the club but he made the number ten position his own in the second half of last season having been deployed there by Corberan, and in the absence of regular central playmaker John Swift who had been sidelined through injury.

arts.ttl: West Brom set to make late injury call on key man after disrupted training week
arts.sum: Carlos Corberan will make a late call on the availability of West Bromwich Albion midfielder Alex Mowatt ahead of Saturday's trip to Sheffield Wednesday after a disrupted week of training for one of the Baggies' key men. If he completes training on Friday, he can be involved on Saturday."
